jhelp.android.api

Class StateMachine<INFORMATION>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jhelp.android.api.StateMachine<INFORMATION>
  • Type Parameters:
    INFORMATION - Information type

    public abstract class StateMachine<INFORMATION>
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic state machine.
    Its run in its own thread.
    Don't forget to call the method destroy() to terminate the thread properly
    Author:
    JHelp

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Called when garbage collector want to free memory.
        It an attempt to stop the embed thread if developer forget call destroy()

        Parent documentation:
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - On issue
        See Also:
        Object.finalize()

      • cancelChangeState

        public final void cancelChangeState(int state)
        Cancel a state before it is sending.
        Work with changeStateDelayed(int, Object, int).
        It can be used for example to manage a timeout.
        Parameters:
        state - State ordered to cancel

      • changeState

        public final void changeState(int state,
               INFORMATION information)
        Change "immediately" the current state
        Parameters:
        state - New state
        information - Information to give to the state (Can be null)

      • changeStateDelayed

        public final void changeStateDelayed(int state,
                      INFORMATION information,
                      int millisecondDelay)
        Change the current state in a given millisecond delay.
        The changing can be canceled by cancelChangeState(int)
        Parameters:
        state - New state
        information - Information to give to the state (Can be null)
        millisecondDelay - Delay before change the state

      • destroy

        public final void destroy()
        Stop the internal thread and destroy properly the state machine.
        Call it as soon as you need no more the state machine or on the onDestroy of your Activity, for example

      • getCurrentState

        public final int getCurrentState()
        Current state
        Returns:
        Current state

      • stateChanged

        public abstract boolean stateChanged(int currentState,
                   int futureState,
                   INFORMATION information)
        Called when a state is about to changed.
        If it is possible to go on the desired state this method return true, if the changing is not allowed, its return false
        Its also there is done the action corresponds to a state
        Parameters:
        currentState - Current state
        futureState - Desired state
        information - Future state information
        Returns:
        true if the state changing is allowed
